intro: Leptochilus mexicanus, commonly known as the Mexican spurge, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its low water requirements, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
